223483827.body:
$spg 8.9b market cap and generates 5b revenue....owns real assets around the world enterprise value

 $ZM 72.44billion generates 824m enterprise value 71b, has very few real assets

Both industries have challenges simon has to adjust to a pandemic and changing world, zoom has to adjust to competitors and wuickly changing texhnology trends and recovery

But the difference shows you how unloved real estate is creating a value play and how bloated and hyped all technology stocks are.  If you are interested in contrarion plays and long term value take a look at $SPG 

Thanks for coming to my ted talk, honorable mention $SLG 1b rev 3bill market cap.  And open up your credit spreads on $DOCU it has run too far ☕️

223481983.body:
$SPY $CVNA $ZM 

Rough week for me even though we made an amazing trade on $CVNA this week. Usually when I have a shitty week I try to take a day or two off, but I went a bit on tilt myself. Even though I’ve been trading for many many years 10+... I still have these moments where my emotions take over and I’ll take a small loss and fuel it with more emotions that turns into a massive loss. This week got to me more than I’d like. I know if I stick my my game plan I have consistent profits. I am still up big YTD but lost ground on my continuous progress. The market is open every day (almost) and opportunities are there. I will get back to my strategy that has worked and slowly grind back. Truly the only way to consistently profit. 

www.pineapplestocks.com

$ZM can t beat nasdaq today. Daily new deaths are decreasing. Competition. Security issues. Bans. 
Thats why I m bearish. 
Looking at analyst estimates.
Projecting 0,45 eps for next quarter.

Unrealistic scenario: they do 0,5 eps every quarter, so in one year thats 2 eps.
That would put the pe at 125.
Thats why I m bearish.

224326891.body: $ZM Talk about fear mongering.  TX has been called a hot spot recently but the data paints a different picture.  As of JUN 29, the State of 29.7M had reported 2,403 C-19 deaths or 0.0081%.  The Cumulative Cases (all cases) to date is 153,011 or 0.516%.  In the 10 largest counties (incldg Harris, Dallas, Tarrant, Bexar) cumulative cases is only 0.55% and fatalities are 0.00825%.   https://dshs.texas.gov/coronavirus/TexasCOVID19DailyCountyCaseCountData.xlsx  and https://dshs.texas.gov/coronavirus/TexasCOVID19DailyCountyFatalityCountData.xlsx
